subject: Automobile Racing
Drag Racing
Accidents and Safety
lead_paragraph: In the wake of Scott Kalitta’s recent fatal accident, the National Hot Rod Association took an interim step, reducing the length of top fuel and funny car races from 1,320 feet to 1,000. The change will take effect this weekend at the Mopar Mile-High Nationals in Colorado. The pro stock and pro stock motorcycle classes will continue to run a quarter-mile. It will be the first time the N.H.R.A. has conducted racing at any distance other than a quarter-mile at a national event. Kalitta died June 21 in Englishtown, N.J., after his funny car burst into flames and slammed into a retaining barrier.
